qas.question: During which time period did the legend of Virgil in his Basket arise?
What is the name of the beautiful woman who Virgil enamoured?
Which story did Virgil being left halfway in basket parallel?
Which artist made a woodcut and later an engraving of Virgil and his basket?
When did Lucas van Leyden live?
Who was one of the writers who wrote about Virgil in his Basket?
What form of art did the most artists use to depict Virgil in his Basket?

context: The legend of Virgil in his Basket arose in <b4_0><b8_0>the <a0_0>Middle Ages<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, and is often seen in art and mentioned in literature as part of the Power of Women literary topos, demonstrating the disruptive force of female attractiveness on men. In this story Virgil became enamoured of a beautiful woman, sometimes described as <b5_0>the emperor's daughter<b5_0/> or mistress and called <a1_0>Lucretia<a1_0/>. She played him along and agreed to an assignation at her house, which he was to sneak into at night by climbing into a large basket let down from a window. When he did so he was only hoisted halfway up the wall and then left him trapped there into the next day, exposed to public ridicule. The story paralleled that of <a2_0>Phyllis riding <b6_0>Aristotle<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Among other artists depicting the scene, <a3_0>Lucas van Leyden<a3_0/> made a woodcut and later an <b7_0>engraving<b7_0/>.
